alert.note: Alert for DeKalb; Jackson; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 12:59PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Marshall, central Jackson and DeKalb Counties through 145 PM CST... At 1258 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from South Pittsburg to near Scottsboro to Arab. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Albertville, Scottsboro, Fort Payne, Boaz, Guntersville, Arab, Rainsville, Bridgeport, Henagar and Stevenson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CST for north central and northeastern Alabama.
